page.title: 17FARMING INDUSTRY-DUNURE (1)
page.content: In the area surrounding Dunure there are 4 farms of varying sizes.Drumbain with 100 acres has belonged to the same family for 150 years.Their land is on a long lease to nearby farmer who grows barley on half and uses other half for grazing.The other 3 farms have all changed ownership within the last 3 years and are all mixed farms.Lagg Farm 480 acres mainly dairy with 130 cows.Calves reared as replacements in dairy herd,males sold as stores at 12/18 months.Year average total of 350 cattle.250 breeding ewes and lambs are fattened.40 acres barley for winter feed with home grown silage.Lagg and Fisherton do "Bed and Breakfast" for summer tourists.Owing to mechanisation the farms have fewer workers (1 or 2)and some cottages have been sold.
